page.title: 06JOBS SURVEY,WATERLANE.
page.content: Nobody in our survey was unemployed, actually was looking for work. Several people were retired and some of the ladies worked as{housewives.}Most people have important jobs like{bank {managers,}or{teachers.}The{vice {principal}of the Royal Agricultural College Cirencester was in our survey.One man had been in charge of 10,000 workers when he had worked in Central Africa Engineering Project Many people worked away from their homes. Gloucester, Cirencester and Reading were quoted,also 2 people worked abroad.Some worked nearby and we questioned 2{farmers.}The women tended to do{office work}the men to have more important jobs.Everyone we asked liked their work,except a student. All felt it was worth living in Waterlane and away from their work place.{
